snippet: More than 800,000 New York City residents will live in flood zones by the 2050s, according to warnings issued by the Bloomberg administration, which hopes to encourage better preparation for climate change.
abstract: Bloomberg administration issues new warnings about New York City’s vulnerability to climate change, attempting to encourage businesses, residents and lawmakers to better prepare for hotter weather, fiercer storms and increased rainfall; administration estimates that more than 800,000 city residents will live in flood zones by the 2050s, more than double the estimate of the Federal Emergency Management Agency.
lead_paragraph: More than 800,000 New York City residents will live in flood zones by the 2050s, according to warnings issued by the Bloomberg administration, which hopes to encourage better preparation for climate change.
